title: Document the behavior of creating empty subslice at end of slice

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-docs
labels.description: Area: documentation for any part of the project, including the compiler, standard library, and tools

body:
Creating an empty subslice at the end of a slice succeeds: `&slice[slice.len()..]`, however this doesn't appear to be documented in [the slice documentation](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/primitive.slice.html).

From some searching, I found efforts to document this behavior, including https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/32183, however this documentation doesn't seem to appear in [slice's doc page](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/primitive.slice.html) or the [index function's doc page](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ops/trait.Index.html#tymethod.index).

The place I originally looked was on [slice's `get` function](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/primitive.slice.html#method.get).

This might be related to [rustdoc omitting some documentation](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/31821), however https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/31821#issuecomment-453183138 says to file specific issues, so here's a specific issue :-).
